review: I installed the software for the Chromecast on my computer and iPhone. It was a bit glitchy to set up, but after setup it was fairly easy to use.  The information for the devise says that you can start a video on your computer and then use your iPhone to stop or start the video, but this is way to cumbersome.  There is no way to pause the video, so you need to stop the video and then start it on the second devise where it loads again.  And while you are doing this it is using two of your subscription devises on Netflix.  I decided to stick with one device to control the video, and it works great except for not being able to pause the video.  Hopefully Google will update the software to handle that.I am pleased with Chromecast overall and since I only plan to use it for Netflix, I haven't tested the other features.  And because it is so portable, I will be able to easily move it to another TV.  And when I buy a new HD TV, it won't have to be a more expensive Smart TV.  Keep in mind that Chromecast is only 720p so will not take full advantage of your 1080p TV.  It is powered through your USB port on your TV, but if you don't have a USB port it comes with an AC plug.  I wanted to be able to watch Netflix on a television that is not a Smart TV, and did not want to buy a DVD box that is Netflix capable, and it provides that service for me.

review: Chromecast is very easy to setup and easier to use.  Appears to be a highly portable, quality, reliable device for streaming video from a source device such as a PC, tablet, or smartphone, but there are some limitations.  For me, the inability to stream Amazon Prime instant video is one of those limitations, but not as significant as not being able to stream in a typical hotel environment.  In order to affect streaming, your source device and Chromecast must be able to communicate with each other on the same network - not a problem at home.  While hotel networks will generally permit network access by more than one user device at a time, they typically do not permit two user devices to communicate with each other for security reasons, so if you want to view a Netflix movie via Chromecast, you will have to do so with your smartphone set as a wireless hotspot.If and when Google can resolve the above two issues, then this would truly be a five star device!
